interface.name: org.freedesktop.Telepathy.Authentication.TLSCertificate.DRAFT
interface.tp:docstring: This object represents a TLS certificate.

tp:docstring.p: The raw data contained in a TLS certificate.
For X.509 certificates (CertificateType = "x509"), this MUST be in DER format, as defined by the X.690 ITU standard.
For PGP certificates (CertificateType = "pgp"), this MUST be a binary OpenPGP key as defined by section 11.1 of RFC 4880.

tp:enum.name: TLS_Certificate_State
tp:enum.tp:docstring: The possible states for a TLSCertificate.DRAFT object.

tp:enumvalue.tp:docstring: The certificate is currently waiting to be accepted or rejected.

tp:enum.name: TLS_Certificate_Reject_Reason
tp:enum.tp:docstring: Possible reasons to reject a TLS certificate.

tp:enumvalue.tp:docstring: The certificate has been rejected for another reason not listed in this enumeration.
The certificate is not active yet.
The certificate provided does not have the expected fingerprint.
The hostname certified does not match the provided one.
The certificate uses an insecure cipher algorithm, or is cryptographically weak.
The length in bytes of the certificate, or the depth of the certificate chain exceed the limits imposed by the crypto library.

property.name: State
property.tp:docstring: The current state of this certificate. State change notifications happen by means of the Accepted and Rejected signals.

tp:docstring.p: If the State is Rejected, the reason why the certificate was rejected; this MAY correspond to the RejectReason, or MAY be a more specific D-Bus error name, perhaps implementation-specific.
If the State is not Rejected, this property is not meaningful, and SHOULD be set to an empty string.
If the State is Rejected, additional information about why the certificate was rejected.
If the State is not Rejected, this property is not meaningful and SHOULD be set to an empty map.
The additional information MAY also include one or more of the following well-known keys:

dl.dd: True if the error was due to an user-requested rejection of the certificate; False if there was an unrecoverable error in the verification process.
If the rejection reason is Hostname_Mismatch, the hostname that the server certificate was expected to have.
Debugging information on the error, corresponding to the message part of a D-Bus error message, which SHOULD NOT be displayed to users under normal circumstances

property.name: RejectReason
property.tp:docstring:
If the State is Rejected, the reason why the certificate was rejected.
Clients that do not understand the RejectError, which may be implementation-specific, can use this property to classify rejection reasons into common categories.
Otherwise, this property is not meaningful, and SHOULD be set to Unknown.

property.name: CertificateType
property.tp:docstring:
The type of this TLS certificate (e.g. 'x509' or 'pgp').
This property is immutable

tp:docstring.p: One or more TLS certificates forming a trust chain, each encoded as specified by Certificate_Data.
The first certificate in the chain MUST be the server certificate, followed by the issuer's certificate, followed by the issuer's issuer and so on.

signal.name: Accepted
signal.tp:docstring: The State of this certificate has changed to Accepted.

signal.name: Rejected
signal.tp:docstring: The State of this certificate has changed to Rejected.

method.name: Accept
method.tp:docstring: Accepts this certificate, i.e. marks it as verified.
